Distributed Summary

Created:2018-01-14  Last modified:2018-09-27

  • Introduction
  • Architecture
  • Frameworks
  • Concepts

  1. Introduction

    1. Communication

    Message passing in DS: RPC, RESTful API

    2. Architecture

    client-server, n-tier, p2p.

    3. Design Issue

    1. Degree of Transparency
    2. Scalability
    3. Degree of Consistency

    4. Distributed Algorithms

    1. No single node has complete information about the entire system states.
    2. Individual node makes decisions only based on local information.
    3. Failure of one machine does not ruin the algorithm
    4. No global clock exists

    5. False assumptions in DS

    1. Network is reliable, secure, homogeneous
    2. Topology does not change
    3. Latency is zero, bandwidth is infinite.
    4. There is a master (administrator) node

  2. Architecture

    Distributed system can be organized as a middleware between heterogeneous OS and higher-level application.

    Middleware should provide functions, such as message-passing, lock, multicast, authentication.

  3. Frameworks (For processing big data)

    Apache Hadoop ecosystem

  4. Concepts

    1. Idempotence: the effect of call once and call multiple times are same. For example, .setOn(true) is idempotent .increaseOne() is not.
